text: Frank John Glieber (April 5, 1934 â€“ May 1, 1985) was an American sportscaster. He called college football games for CBS Radio, the Dallas Cowboys, Cleveland Browns on CBS, and the Texas Rangers. While working for CBS, Glieber called National Football League, National Basketball Association, college football, college basketball, soccer, tennis, bowling, and golf. He died of a heart attack in May of 1985. == References == Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters Category:Golf broadcasters Category:National Football League broadcasters Category:Tennis broadcasters Category:Association football broadcasters Category:Bowling broadcasters Category:College basketball broadcasters Category:College football broadcasters Category:National Basketball Association broadcasters Category:People from Wisconsin Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:1985 deaths Category:1934 births
title: Frank Glieber
